summary:
Sakha, officially the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia), is the biggest republic in Russia, located in the far east near the Arctic Ocean. It's the world's largest country subdivision, covering over 3 million square kilometers. The capital, Yakutsk, is one of the coldest major cities globally.

Originally home to Tungusic and Paleosiberian peoples, the Turkic Sakha people settled there between the 9th and 16th centuries. Russians colonized the area in the 17th century, and it became part of the Tsardom of Russia. In 1991, it became the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia).
title: Sakha Republic
